pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.16.pli: Atha kho migalaṇḍiko samaṇakuttako pattacīvarehi bhaṭo sambahule bhikkhū jīvitā voropetvā lohitakaṁ asiṁ ādāya yena vaggumudā nadī tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.1.16.en: And hired for a bowl and robes, Migalaṇḍika killed a number of monks. He took his blood-stained knife to the river Vaggumudā,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.2.pli: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū attanāpi attānaṁ jīvitā voropenti, aññamaññampi jīvitā voropenti migalaṇḍikampi samaṇakuttakaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.2.en: “Is it true, monks, that some monks have taken their own lives, have killed one another, and have said to Migalaṇḍika,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.7.pli: Kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū attanāpi attānaṁ jīvitā voropessanti, aññamaññampi jīvitā voropessanti, migalaṇḍikampi samaṇakuttakaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vakkhanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:1.4.7.en: How could those monks take their own lives, kill one another, and say to Migalaṇḍika,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.49.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṁ jīvitā voropeyya satthahārakaṁ vāssa pariyeseyya maraṇavaṇṇaṁ vā saṁvaṇṇeyya maraṇāya vā samādapeyya—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:2.49.1.en: ‘If a monk intentionally kills a human being or seeks an instrument of death for him or praises death or incites someone to die, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.43.pli: evameva bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṁ jīvitā voropetvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:3.43.en: so too a monk who has intentionally killed a human being is not an ascetic, not a son of the Sakyan.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.2.pli: sayaṁ hanati kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.2.en: one oneself kills by means of the body or by means of something connected to the body or by means of something released.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.6.pli: So taṁ maññamāno taṁ jīvitā voropeti, āpatti ubhinnaṁ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.6.en: If the second monk kills that person, thinking he is the one he was told to kill, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.8.pli: So taṁ maññamāno aññaṁ jīvitā voropeti, mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti. Vadhakassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.8.en: If the second monk kills someone else, thinking he is the one he was told to kill, there is no offense for the instigator, but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the murderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.10.pli: So aññaṁ maññamāno taṁ jīvitā voropeti, āpatti ubhinnaṁ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.10.en: If the second monk kills that person, thinking it is someone else than the one he was told to kill, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.12.1.pli: So aññaṁ maññamāno aññaṁ jīvitā voropeti; mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti, vadhakassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.12.1.en: If the second monk kills someone else, thinking it is someone else than the one he was told to kill, there is no offense for the instigator, but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the murderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.13.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṁ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmassa pāvada—‘itthannāmo itthannāmassa pāvadatu—itthannāmo itthannāmaṁ jīvitā voropetū’”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.13.en: If a monk tells a second monk, “Tell so-and-so to tell so-and-so to kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.17.pli: Bhikkhu bhikkhuṁ āṇāpeti— “itthannāmassa pāvada—‘itthannāmo itthannāmassa pāvadatu—itthannāmo itthannāmaṁ jīvitā voropetū’”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.17.en: If a monk tells a second monk, “Tell so-and-so to tell so-and-so to kill so-and-so,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.23.pli: So gantvā puna paccāgacchati— “nāhaṁ sakkomi taṁ jīvitā voropetun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.23.en: He goes, but returns, saying, “I wasn’t able to kill them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.31.pli: So—“āṇatto ahaṁ tayā”ti taṁ jīvitā voropeti, mūlaṭṭhassa anāpatti. Vadhakassa āpatti pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.2.31.en: If the second monk replies, “I’ve been told by you to do so,” and then kills that person, there is no offense for the instigator, but there is an offense entailing expulsion for the murderer.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.10.pli: saṅketaṁ karoti purebhattaṁ vā pacchābhattaṁ vā rattiṁ vā divā vā— “tena saṅketena taṁ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.10.en: if a monk makes an appointment for before the meal or for after the meal, for the night or for the day, telling another person, “Kill that person according to this appointment,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.11.pli: Tena saṅketena taṁ jīvitā voropeti, āpatti ubhinnaṁ pārājikassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.11.en: If the other person kills that person according to that appointment, there is an offense entailing expulsion for both.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.14.pli: nimittaṁ karoti— “akkhiṁ vā nikhaṇissāmi bhamukaṁ vā ukkhipissāmi sīsaṁ vā ukkhipissāmi, tena nimittena taṁ jīvitā voropehī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:4.10.14.en: a monk makes a sign. If he says to another person, “When I wink … ,” “When I raise my eyebrow … ,” “When I nod, at that sign kill that person,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.8.en: “I didn’t mean to kill him, Sir.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.13.en: and meaning to kill him, he seized him by the back and pushed him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.4.20.en: and meaning to kill him, he seized him by the back and pushed him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.8.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo tassa bhikkhuno gīvāyaṁ pahāraṁ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.8.en: A second monk, meaning to kill him, hit him on the neck.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.14.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo tassa bhikkhuno gīvāyaṁ pahāraṁ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.5.14.en: Another monk, meaning to kill him, hit him on the neck.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.9.pli: Uparimo bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo heṭṭhimassa bhikkhuno matthake silaṁ muñci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.7.9.en: A second monk who was above, aiming to kill the monk below, dropped the stone on his head.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.11.7.en: “I didn’t mean to kill him, Sir.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.11.10.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo aññataraṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.11.10.en: A monk, meaning to kill him, said to a second monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.12.8.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.12.8.en: A second monk, meaning to kill him, said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.14.7.en: The monks, meaning to kill him, made him sweat by heating him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.15.7.en: The monks, meaning to kill him, gave him medical treatment through the nose.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.16.7.en: The monks, meaning to kill him, massaged him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.16.19.en: The monks, meaning to kill him, bathed him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.16.31.en: The monks, meaning to kill him, smeared him with oil.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.16.43.en: The monks, meaning to kill him, made him get up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.16.55.en: The monks, meaning to kill him, made him lie down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.16.67.en: The monks, meaning to kill him, gave him food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.16.79.en: The monks, meaning to kill him, gave him a drink.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.25.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo aññataraṁ bhikkhuṁ vāḷayakkhavihāraṁ pāhesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.25.5.en: On one occasion a monk sent a second monk to a dwelling inhabited by predatory spirits, meaning to kill him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.26.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo aññataraṁ bhikkhuṁ vāḷakantāraṁ pāhesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.26.5.en: On one occasion a monk sent a second monk to a wilderness inhabited by predatory animals, meaning to kill him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.26.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo aññataraṁ bhikkhuṁ corakantāraṁ pāhesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.26.15.en: On one occasion a monk sent a second monk to a wilderness inhabited by criminals, meaning to kill him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.28.7.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo tassa bhikkhuno pahāraṁ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.28.7.en: A second monk, meaning to kill him, gave him a blow.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.29.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo kalyāṇakammassa saggakathaṁ kathesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.29.5.en: On one occasion a monk gave a talk about heaven to a man of good behavior, meaning to kill him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.29.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo nerayikassa nirayakathaṁ kathesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.29.15.en: On one occasion a monk gave a talk about hell to a man bound for hell, meaning to kill him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.30.8.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu maraṇādhippāyo aññataraṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj3:5.30.8.en: A monk, meaning to kill a second monk, said to him,

pli-tv-kd17:3.5.34.en: “Why do you want to kill me?”

pli-tv-kd17:3.6.2.pli: “purise, mahārāja, āṇāpehi, ye samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ jīvitā voropessantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.6.2.en: “Great king, tell your men to kill the ascetic Gotama.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.9.2.pli: “nāhaṁ, bhante, sakkomi taṁ bhagavantaṁ jīvitā voropetuṁ;
pli-tv-kd17:3.9.2.en: “I wasn’t able to kill him, Sir.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.17.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso, yaṁ parūpakkamena tathāgataṁ jīvitā voropeyya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.17.en: “It’s impossible, monks, for anyone to kill me through an act of violence.

pli-tv-kd17:3.10.50.pli: “Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso, yaṁ parūpakkamena tathāgataṁ jīvitā voropeyya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.10.50.en: It’s impossible for anyone to kill me through an act of violence.

pli-tv-kd17:3.11.18.pli: Aṭṭhānametaṁ, bhikkhave, anavakāso, yaṁ parūpakkamena tathāgataṁ jīvitā voropeyya.
pli-tv-kd17:3.11.18.en: It’s impossible for anyone to kill the Buddha through an act of violence.

pli-tv-kd17:3.13.2.pli: “yāva pāpo ayaṁ devadatto, alakkhiko, yatra hi nāma samaṇassa gotamassa evaṁmahiddhikassa evaṁmahānubhāvassa vadhāya parakkamissatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd17:3.13.2.en: “How evil he is this Devadatta, how benighted, in that he tries to kill the ascetic Gotama so powerful and mighty.”

pli-tv-kd17:3.15.16.en: one hasn’t seen, heard, or suspected that the animal was specifically killed to feed a monastic.”

pli-tv-kd5:9.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū aciravatiyā nadiyā gāvīnaṁ tarantīnaṁ visāṇesupi gaṇhanti, kaṇṇesupi gaṇhanti, gīvāyapi gaṇhanti, cheppāpi gaṇhanti, piṭṭhimpi abhiruhanti, rattacittāpi aṅgajātaṁ chupanti, vacchatarimpi ogāhetvā mārenti.
pli-tv-kd5:9.1.4.en: At this time, when cattle were crossing the Aciravatī river, the monks from the group of six would grab them by the horns, the ears, the neck, and the tail, and they mounted their backs, and motivated by lust, they touched their genitals. They even killed a calf by submerging it.

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.9.en: they said, “So did you encourage someone to kill?”

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.12.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu pāṇātipāte samādapessati, nanu bhagavatā anekapariyāyena pāṇātipāto garahito, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pasatthā”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:10.9.12.en: “How can a monk encourage someone to kill? Hasn’t the Buddha in many ways criticized killing and praised the abstention from killing?”

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.2.en: “Is it true, monk, that you encouraged someone to kill?”

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.4.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṁ, moghapurisa, pāṇātipāte samādapessasi, nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena pāṇātipāto garahito, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pasatthā.
pli-tv-kd5:10.10.4.en: “Foolish man, how can you encourage someone to kill? Haven’t I in many ways criticized killing and praised the abstention from killing?

mn93:7.5.pli: khattiyova nu kho pāṇātipātī adinnādāyī kāmesumicchācārī musāvādī pisuṇavāco pharusavāco samphappalāpī abhijjhālu byāpannacitto micchādiṭṭhi kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjeyya, no brāhmaṇo?
mn93:7.5.en: Suppose an aristocrat were to kill living creatures, steal, and commit sexual misconduct; to use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical; and to be covetous, malicious, with wrong view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’d be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell. Would this happen only to an aristocrat, and not to a brahmin?

mn93:7.13.pli: sabbepi hi, bho gotama, cattāro vaṇṇā pāṇātipātino adinnādāyino kāmesumicchācārino musāvādino pisuṇavācā pharusavācā samphappalāpino abhijjhālū byāpannacittā micchādiṭṭhī kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjeyyun”ti.
mn93:7.13.en: For if any of the four classes were to kill living creatures, steal, and commit sexual misconduct; to use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical; and to be covetous, malicious, with wrong view, then, when their body breaks up, after death, they’d be reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”

mn93:8.5.pli: brāhmaṇova nu kho pāṇātipātā paṭivirato adinnādānā paṭivirato kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato musāvādā paṭivirato pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato samphappalāpā paṭivirato anabhijjhālu abyāpannacitto sammādiṭṭhi kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjeyya, no khattiyo, no vesso, no suddo”ti?
mn93:8.5.en: Suppose a brahmin were to refrain from killing living creatures, stealing, and committing sexual misconduct; from using speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical; and from covetousness, malice, and wrong view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’d be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm. Would this happen only to an brahmin, and not to an aristocrat, a merchant, or a worker?”

mn93:8.11.pli: sabbepi hi, bho gotama, cattāro vaṇṇā pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā adinnādānā paṭiviratā kāmesumicchācārā paṭiviratā musāvādā paṭiviratā pisuṇāya vācāya paṭiviratā pharusāya vācāya paṭiviratā samphappalāpā paṭiviratā anabhijjhālū abyāpannacittā sammādiṭṭhī kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjeyyun”ti.
mn93:8.11.en: For if any of the four classes were to refrain from killing living creatures, stealing, and committing sexual misconduct; from using speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical; and from covetousness, malice, and wrong view, then, when their body breaks up, after death, they’d be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”

an4.264:1.3.pli: Attanā ca pāṇātipātī hoti, parañca pāṇātipāte samādapeti, pāṇātipāte ca samanuñño hoti, pāṇātipātassa ca vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati—
an4.264:1.3.en: They themselves kill living creatures; they encourage others to kill living creatures; they approve of killing living creatures; and they praise killing living creatures.

an4.264:2.3.pli: Attanā ca pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, parañca pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā samādapeti, pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā ca samanuñño hoti, pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā ca vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati—
an4.264:2.3.en: They don’t themselves kill living creatures; they encourage others to not kill living creatures; they approve of not killing living creatures; and they praise not killing living creatures.

mn54:6.3.pli: ‘yesaṁ kho ahaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ hetu pāṇātipātī assaṁ, tesāhaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ pahānāya samucchedāya paṭipanno.
mn54:6.3.en: ‘I am practicing to give up and cut off the fetters that might cause me to kill living creatures.

mn54:6.4.pli: Ahañceva kho pana pāṇātipātī assaṁ, attāpi maṁ upavadeyya pāṇātipātapaccayā, anuviccāpi maṁ viññū garaheyyuṁ pāṇātipātapaccayā, kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā pāṇātipātapaccayā.
mn54:6.4.en: But if I were to kill living creatures, because of that I would reprimand myself; sensible people, after examination, would criticize me; and when my body breaks up, after death, I could expect to be reborn in a bad place.

mn119:8.3.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, dakkho goghātako vā goghātakantevāsī vā gāviṁ vadhitvā catumahāpathe bilaso vibhajitvā nisinno assa;
mn119:8.3.en: It’s as if a deft butcher or butcher’s apprentice were to kill a cow and sit down at the crossroads with the meat cut into portions.

Middle Discourses 119
Mindfulness of the Body

mn10:12.3.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, dakkho goghātako vā goghātakantevāsī vā gāviṁ vadhitvā catumahāpathe bilaso vibhajitvā nisinno assa.
mn10:12.3.en: It’s as if a deft butcher or butcher’s apprentice were to kill a cow and sit down at the crossroads with the meat cut into portions.

dn4:20.10.pli: Aṅgako kho māṇavako pāṇampi haneyya, adinnampi ādiyeyya, paradārampi gaccheyya, musāvādampi bhaṇeyya, majjampi piveyya, ettha dāni, bho, kiṁ vaṇṇo karissati, kiṁ mantā, kiṁ jāti?
dn4:20.10.en: But if Aṅgaka were to kill living creatures, steal, commit adultery, lie, and drink alcohol, then what’s the use of his appearance, his hymns, or his birth?

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 4
With Soṇadaṇḍa
1. The Brahmins and Householders of Campā

dn25:16.5.pli: Idha, nigrodha, tapassī na pāṇaṁ atipāteti, na pāṇaṁ atipātayati, na pāṇamatipātayato samanuñño hoti.
dn25:16.5.en: It’s when a mortifier doesn’t kill living creatures, doesn’t get others to kill, and doesn’t approve of killing.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 25
The Lion’s Roar at Udumbarikā’s Monastery
1. On the Wanderer Nigrodha

mn98:11.41.en: not killing or causing others to kill:

mn146:11.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhaginiyo, dakkho goghātako vā goghātakantevāsī vā gāviṁ vadhitvā tiṇhena govikantanena gāviṁ saṅkanteyya anupahacca antaraṁ maṁsakāyaṁ anupahacca bāhiraṁ cammakāyaṁ.
mn146:11.1.en: Suppose a deft butcher or their apprentice was to kill a cow and carve it with a sharp meat cleaver. Without damaging the flesh inside or the hide outside,

dn22:6.3.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, dakkho goghātako vā goghātakantevāsī vā gāviṁ vadhitvā catumahāpathe bilaso vibhajitvā nisinno assa;
dn22:6.3.en: It’s as if a deft butcher or butcher’s apprentice were to kill a cow and sit down at the crossroads with the meat cut into portions.

Long Discourses 22
The Longer Discourse on Mindfulness Meditation
